Based on the search results, I found information about "Pan Tadeusz" as a required reading in Polish schools and the teaching of its famous opening lines "Litwo, ojczyzno". Here's what I found:

## Pan Tadeusz as School Literature

Teachers in Polish language classes sometimes ask students to memorize the invocation from "Pan Tadeusz", which demonstrates its importance as mandatory reading in Polish education.

## The Famous Opening - "Litwo, ojczyzno"

The search results confirm that "Litwo! Ojczyzno moja! ty jesteś jak zdrowie. Ile cię trzeba cenić, ten tylko się dowie, Kto cię stracił. Dziś piękność twą w całej ozdobie Widzę i opisuję, bo tęsknię po tobie." are the opening lines that students learn.

## Teaching Methods and Analysis

Some teachers analyze this fragment with students, while others focus on memorization. The invocation is studied for its literary devices including:

- Apostrophes like "Litwo Ojczyzno moja!" which give the work a solemn character
- The health motif, where a person appreciates health only when they lose it, also referencing Jan Kochanowski's fraszka "Na zdrowie"

## Poetic Structure

Pan Tadeusz is written in thirteen-syllable verse (trzynastozgłoskowiec) with 13 syllables per line and a caesura after the seventh syllable, as exemplified in the opening: "Litwo ojczyzno moja, ty jesteś, jak zdrowie".

The invocation serves as an announcement of the entire work's theme – it will be a story about the homeland.
